thread.title: WikiLeaks informer Chelsea Manning to receive THOUSANDS of pounds when she’s released
thread.title_full: WikiLeaks informer Chelsea Manning to receive THOUSANDS of pounds when she’s released

title: WikiLeaks informer Chelsea Manning to receive THOUSANDS of pounds when she’s released
text:
WikiLeaks informer Chelsea Manning to receive THOUSANDS of pounds when she’s released WikiLeaks informer Chelsea Manning to receive THOUSANDS of pounds when she’s released CHELSEA Manning will receive tens of thousands of pounds when she is freed from prison after friends of the WikiLeaks informer set up a campaign to help prepare for life on the outside. PUBLISHED: 14:27,  39, Thu, Feb 9, 2017 TWITTER Chelsea Manning was due to serve 35 years in prison 
Already more than £32,000 ($40,000) has been raised in just two days for Ms Manning, with fundraisers hoping to find $100,000 to go towards living expenses she could incur when she walks from the military prison where she is detained. 
But if the donations continue at this current rate, Ms Manning will raise £1.58m ($1.98m) by the time she is free, and £5.6m ($7m) in just one year. Related articles Donald Trump blasts WikiLeaks whistleblower Chelsea Manning 
The 29-year-old served as an Army intelligence analyst in the Iraq War, but was jailed for 35 years after being convicted of supplying WikiLeaks with hundreds of thousands of sensitive documents. 
Chelsea Manning then came out as a transgender a day after her sentencing - successfully suing the Pentagon so she could receive hormone replacement therapy while serving time at an all-male military prison. GOFUNDME More than £32,000 has already been raised by supporters 
But she is now due to be released and will head home to Maryland on May 17, after former US President Barack Obama commuted the sentence. 
The “Welcome Home Fund” established for the soldier aims to raise $100,000 (£795k) to go towards various living expenses including rent, utilities, health care, clothing, she could incur in her first year of freedom. 
The fundraising page read: “The majority of Chelsea’s adult life has been spent under the control of powerful institutions. GETTY The 29-year-old served as an Army intelligence analyst in the Iraq War Upon her release she will need logistical, emotional and financial support to safely transition into the free world. Chelsea Manning crowdfunding page 
“Upon her release she will need logistical, emotional and financial support to safely transition into the free world. 
“For the first time in her life, Chelsea will have the opportunity to live freely as her authentic self, to grow her hair, engage with her friends, and build her own networks of love and support. 
“We want her to have the tools to do that and to overcome the years of abuse she has experience in custody.” Facts about WikiLeaks founder, Julian Assange Mon, August 22, 2016 WikiLeaks Founder, Julian Assange has led a very interesting and controversial life which has been at the centre of global debate Getty Images 1 of 10 It is believed that Julian Assange chooses to live in Sweden because the country's media laws are among the world's most protective for journalists 
And despite only being set up on February 7, nearly 900 individuals donors have already contributed more than $20,000 a day. 
The page has also been shared more than 5,500 times on Facebook. 
On Tuesday, Ms Manning shared the page from her twitter account saying; "Awww <3 Thank you all so very much for pitching in & helping me start my new life ^_^" TWITTER Ms Manning thanks supporters in a tweet 
All money will be deposited directly into Ms Manning's bank account, which is being managed by her current power of attorney. 
Upon her release on May 17, she will have full control over all funds. 
While Edward Snowden has campaigned for her release, Wikileaks founder Julian Assange seemed less than happy with the clemency deal - claiming it was used to force him to turn himself in. Related articles
